answerText: carbon dioxide [accept CO2][10] This class of very fast enzymes catalyzes the conversion of bicarbonate to carbon dioxide and vice versa. This enzyme has three histidine residues and a hydroxide group coordinating a zinc ion at its center.

question: Question: Name some things about buffersÂ…in your body. For 10 points each: [10] Perhaps the body's best known buffering system is in the blood.  It involves bicarbonate ions and protons being converted reversibly from this compound and water. This molecule is also a major byproduct of respiration.
